page.title: 16Eresby Old People's Home.
page.content: Eresby Hall was built in l650 and converted into an old people's home in l968. It is owned and run by the council who employ 27 staff to look after the patients. The building has 3 wings and can accomodate 45 old people The home has two floors and there is a lift for the convenience of those in wheel chairs or who have difficulty walking. There is a huge kitchen on the ground floor where all the food is prepared and cooked for the patients and staff. There is a delivery hatch that sends cooked food up to the second floor. The home is surrounded by beautiful gardens tended by an experienced gardener. The old poeple gain much pleasure from admiring the flowers and dosing in the sunshine.
